citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC approved protocol did not provide a written narrative description of the methods and sources used to
determine that alternatives were not available for the procedures that may cause more than momentary pain or distress to
the animals in the protocol. Whenever a proposal for animal use contains procedures that may cause more than
momentary pain or distress to the animals, the IACUC shall determine that the principal investigator has considered
alternatives to those procedures and the principal investigator has provided a written narrative description of the methods
and sources they used to determine that alternatives were not available. This requirement ensures that all procedures
contained in the protocol minimize discomfort, distress, and pain to the animals. The IACUC needs to ensure all protocols
that are submitted that contain any procedure that may cause more than momentary or slight pain or distress to the
animals are in compliance with this section of the regulations.
Correct by 10/15/2023.

The research facility’s annual reports for federal fiscal years 2021 and 2022 were not submitted by the required December
1st deadlines of the respective years to the Deputy Administrator. Appropriate submission of the annual report in a timely
manner is essential to evaluate the information provided in the reports and assure the care and use of animals were
followed according to the Animal Welfare Act regulations. Each reporting facility shall submit an annual report, covering
the use of live animals in the previous fiscal year, on or before December 1st of each calendar year.
Correct by 10/15/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.31(d)(1)(ii) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The IACUC approved protocol did not provide a written narrative description of the methods and sources used to 
determine that alternatives were not available for the procedures that may cause more than momentary pain or distress to 
the animals in the protocol. Whenever a proposal for animal use contains procedures that may cause more than 
momentary pain or distress to the animals, the IACUC shall determine that the principal investigator has considered 
alternatives to those procedures and the principal investigator has provided a written narrative description of the methods 
and sources they used to determine that alternatives were not available. This requirement ensures that all procedures 
contained in the protocol minimize discomfort, distress, and pain to the animals. The IACUC needs to ensure all protocols 
that are submitted that contain any procedure that may cause more than momentary or slight pain or distress to the 
animals are in compliance with this section of the regulations. 
 
Correct by 10/15/2023. 
2.36(a) 
   
Annual report. 
The research facility’s annual reports for federal fiscal years 2021 and 2022 were not submitted by the required December 
1st deadlines of the respective years to the Deputy Administrator. Appropriate submission of the annual report in a timely 
manner is essential to evaluate the information provided in the reports and assure the care and use of animals were 
followed according to the Animal Welfare Act regulations. Each reporting facility shall submit an annual report, covering 
the use of live animals in the previous fiscal year, on or before December 1st of each calendar year. 
 
Correct by 10/15/2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
